channel.title: Step by Step Dev
channel.description: Recent content on Step by Step Dev

item.title: Setup
item.description: What does the author have? I have: a 2017 HP laptop running Windows 10 Home edition (64-bit) i5 Intel processor 8 GB of RAM I have also enabled virtualization in my BIOS (necessary) and have WSL2 enabled (not necessary, but convenient for me) VirtualBox Install VirtualBox from here Follow along with this tutorial to familiarize yourself with Virtualbox Ubuntu 18.04 Server Download Ubuntu 18.

item.title: Network
item.description: Ethernet I have an ethernet cable Virtualbox Network Setting Details ↕ After turning your VM off, go to settings. Under Network configure the following: Adapter 1: Bridged Adapter, Realteck PCIe GbE Family Controller #2 Don’t use Intel (R) Dualband Wireless-AC 3168 if you use Bridged Adapter with an ethernet cable Configure static IP From the article How to configure static ip address on Ubuntu (Linuxize), read the paragraph under “Configuring Static IP address using DHCP”

item.title: Privacy
item.description: Privacy Policy for https://alexk2037.github.io/ At Step by Step Dev, accessible from https://alexk2037.github.io/, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by Step by Step Dev and how we use it. If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us. This Privacy Policy applies only to our online activities and is valid for visitors to our website with regards to the information that they shared and/or collect in Step by Step Dev.

item.title: Prosody
item.description: Traceback[Bosh]: Attempt to perform arithmetic on a table value When I start a meeting I get the following output in the prosody logs: Jul 26 04:17:12 mod_bosh info New BOSH session, assigned it sid 'b0be5f11-8434-4b1d-b707-14a6a703df14' Jul 26 04:17:12 boshb0be5f11-8434-4b1d-b707-14a6a703df14 info Authenticated as df6d8268-d64a-4d0d-855f-e2c20b40c32f@freemeet.net Jul 26 04:17:12 mod_bosh error Traceback[bosh]: ...jitsi-meet/prosody-plugins/mod_external_services.lua:119: attempt to perform arithmetic on a table value stack traceback: ...jitsi-meet/prosody-plugins/mod_external_services.lua:119: in function 'get_services' ...jitsi-meet/prosody-plugins/mod_external_services.lua:169: in function '?

item.title: Logging
item.description: Start, Stop, Restart Jitsi Components # Status $ systemctl status nginx prosody jitsi-videobridge2 jicofo jigasi # Stop $ systemctl stop nginx prosody jitsi-videobridge2 jicofo jigasi # Clear all logs $ rm /var/log/jitsi/*.log # Start in this order $ systemctl start nginx $ systemctl start prosody $ systemctl start jitsi-videobridge2 $ systemctl start jicofo $ systemctl start jigasi # Restart in this order $ systemctl restart nginx $ systemctl restart prosody $ systemctl restart jitsi-videobridge2 $ systemctl restart jicofo $ systemctl restart jigasi Logs & Settings All Logs $ tail -f /var/log/jitsi/*.

item.title: Transcription Config
item.description: Set up Jigasi Read the Jigasi Github repo first. # Install Jigasi $ sudo apt install jigasi SIP User: jigasisipuser@somesite.com Password: abc123321bca Go through Jigasi properties file and uncomment all the transcription-related things. All the relevant settings are under the comment that says “# Options regarding Transcription”. Additionally, we fix SSL/TLS required by client but not supported by server. $ vim /etc/jitsi/jigasi/sip-communicator.properties Relevant Portions of Jigasi Properties File ↕ .

item.title: Python Setup
item.description: Install Python 3.8 What version of Python can I use? ↕ By default, Ubuntu 18.04 comes with Python 3.6, however,for Vosk nshmyrev on GitHub recommends Python 3.8 Follow the article step by step: How to install Python 3.8 on Ubuntu 18.04 (Linuxize) To set Python 3.8.11 as the default simply add the following to the end of your Shell profile $ vim ~/.bashrc # ~/.bashrc alias python3="python3.8" $ source ~/.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Read the Official Jitsi Self-Hosting Guide first, then come back here. Install required packages and update repository # For data encryption $ sudo apt install gnupg2 # Web server $ sudo apt install nginx-full # TEST: enter you ip address in your browser. You should see a default Nginx landing page # Install Java Runtime Environment $ sudo apt install default-jre $ java -version >>> openjdk version "11.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Relevant Links Official Website Vosk API Vosk Server Set up Vosk as a system daemon We’ll set up Vosk as a daemon using systemd. In other words, we’ll configure Vosk to run on the VM in the background. Git & Vosk Server files $ cd $HOME $ git clone https://github.com/alphacep/vosk-server.git Install dependencies $ python3 -m pip install aiortc aiohttp aiorpc vosk $ python3 -m pip install websockets Download Speech Recognition model:
